verses.verse: Moreover the Lord <S%H3068><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Job <S%H347><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
Shall he that contends <S%H7378><s%> with the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> instruct <S%H3250><s%> him <S%H3198><s%>? he that reproves God <S%H433><s%>, let him answer it <S%H6030><s%>.
Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
Behold <S%H7043><s%>, I am vile; what shall I answer <S%H7725><s%> you <S%H7760><s%>? I will lay my hand <S%H3027><s%> upon <S%H3926><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
Once <S%H259><s%> have I spoken <S%H1696><s%>; but I will not answer <S%H6030><s%>: Yes <S%H8147><s%>, twice; but I will proceed no further <S%H3254><s%>.
Then answered <S%H6030><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> unto Job <S%H347><s%> out of the whirlwind <S%H5591><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
Dress up <S%H247><s%> your body <S%H2504><s%> now like a man <S%H1397><s%>: I will demand <S%H7592><s%> of you <S%H3045><s%>, and declare you unto me.
Will you also annul <S%H6565><s%> my judgment <S%H4941><s%>? will you condemn <S%H7561><s%> me <S%H6663><s%>, that you may be righteous?
Have you a arm <S%H2220><s%> like God <S%H410><s%>? or can you thunder <S%H7481><s%> with a voice like him <S%H6963><s%>?
Deck <S%H5710><s%> yourself now with majesty <S%H1347><s%> and excellency <S%H1363><s%>; and array <S%H3847><s%> yourself with glory <S%H1935><s%> and beauty <S%H1926><s%>.
Cast abroad <S%H6327><s%> the rage <S%H5678><s%> of your wrath <S%H639><s%>: and behold <S%H7200><s%> every one that is proud <S%H1343><s%>, and abase him <S%H8213><s%>.
Look <S%H7200><s%> on every one that is proud <S%H1343><s%>, and bring him low <S%H3665><s%>; and tread down <S%H1915><s%> the wicked in their place <S%H7563><s%>.
Hide <S%H2934><s%> them in the dust <S%H6083><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>; and bind <S%H2280><s%> their faces <S%H6440><s%> in secret <S%H2934><s%>.
Then will I also confess <S%H3034><s%> unto you that your own right hand <S%H3225><s%> can save you <S%H3467><s%>.
Behold now behemoth <S%H930><s%>, which I made <S%H6213><s%> with you <S%H398><s%>; he eats grass <S%H2682><s%> as a ox <S%H1241><s%>.
Behold now <S%H3581><s%>, his strength is in his body <S%H4975><s%>, and his force <S%H202><s%> is in the navel <S%H8306><s%> of his belly <S%H990><s%>.
He moves <S%H2654><s%> his tail <S%H2180><s%> like a cedar <S%H730><s%>: the sinews <S%H1517><s%> of his stones <S%H6344><s%> are wrapped together <S%H8276><s%>.
His bones <S%H6106><s%> are as strong <S%H650><s%> pieces of brass <S%H5154><s%>; his bones <S%H1634><s%> are like bars <S%H4300><s%> of iron <S%H1270><s%>.
He is the chief <S%H7225><s%> of the ways <S%H1870><s%> of God <S%H410><s%>: he that made <S%H6213><s%> him can make <S%H5066><s%> his sword <S%H2719><s%> to approach unto him <S%H5066><s%>.
Surely the mountains <S%H2022><s%> bring him forth <S%H5375><s%> food <S%H944><s%>, where all the animals <S%H2416><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> play <S%H7832><s%>.
He lies <S%H7901><s%> under the shady trees <S%H6628><s%>, in the covert <S%H5643><s%> of the reed <S%H7070><s%>, and fens <S%H1207><s%>.
The shady trees <S%H6628><s%> cover <S%H5526><s%> him with their shadow <S%H6752><s%>; the willows <S%H6155><s%> of the brook <S%H5158><s%> compass him about <S%H5437><s%>.
Behold <S%H6231><s%>, he drinks up a river <S%H5104><s%>, and hastens <S%H2648><s%> not <S%H982><s%>: he trusts that he can draw up <S%H1518><s%> Jordan <S%H3383><s%> into his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
He takes <S%H3947><s%> it with his eyes <S%H5869><s%>: his nose <S%H639><s%> pierces through <S%H5344><s%> snares <S%H4170><s%>.
